qas.question: Which Jewish synagogue boasts the largest membership in Europe?
The Sephardic Jewish community in London is affiliated with which Synagogue?
For how long has the Bevis Marks Synagogue in London been conducting religious services continuously?
London's Stanmore and Canons Park Synagogue passed London's Ilford Synagogue in terms of membership in what year?
When was the London Jewish Forum established?

context: The majority of British Jews live in London, with significant Jewish communities in Stamford Hill, Stanmore, Golders Green, Finchley, Hampstead, Hendon and Edgware in North London. <a1_0>Bevis Marks Synagogue<a1_0/> in the City of London is affiliated to London's historic Sephardic Jewish community. It is the only synagogue in Europe which has held regular services continuously for <a2_0>over 300 years<a2_0/>. <a0_0>Stanmore and Canons Park Synagogue<a0_0/> has the largest membership of any single Orthodox synagogue in the whole of Europe, overtaking Ilford synagogue (also in London) in <a3_0>1998<a3_0/>. The community set up the London Jewish Forum in <a4_0>2006<a4_0/> in response to the growing significance of devolved London Government.
